body.directions: Listen to the audio, and then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following items do you most likely find on the furniture said in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 枕头 zhěntóu (pillow)
options: Audio for 冰激凌 bīngjīlíng (ice cream)
Audio for 阳台 yángtái (balcony)
Audio for 勺子 sháozi (spoon)
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 床 chuáng means “bed,” and the one item you can most likely find would be a 枕头 zhěntóu (pillow). Maybe not a spoon or ice cream.
body.incorrect: Very close. Listen to the audio several times to understand its meaning, and then consider what you usually see on this item in your everyday life.

body.textVersion: Audio for 整理 zhěnglǐ (to tidy up/to sort out)

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed with the word in the audio?
body.answer: 我今天上午_____卧室。Wǒ jīntiān shàngwǔ _____ wòshì.
options: 她下午两点_____数学课。Tā xiàwǔ liǎngdiǎn _____ shùxuékè.
他喜欢_____比萨饼。Tā xǐhuān _____ bǐsàbǐng.
我姐姐星期一_____生日。Wǒ jiějie xīngqīyī _____ shēngrì.
body.correct: You got it! 整理 zhěnglǐ means “to tidy up/to sort out,” and it can be used for the sentence 我今天上午整理卧室。Wǒjīntiān shàngwǔ zhěnglǐ wòshì. (I tidied up the bedroom this morning.) You might not want to “tidy up” a math class.
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen to the word again to understand its meaning. Then, try it for all four sentences in the choices to see which one makes the most sense in both meaning and structure.

body.quiz: Which of the following places need the item said in the audio the most?
body.correct: Outstanding job! 床单 chuángdān means “bedsheet,” and a hotel will need a lot of bedsheets for the beds in its rooms
body.incorrect: Oops…listen to the word again to identify its meaning. Then consider how each of the places function and which one needs the item the most.

body.quiz: Which of the following words contains the same final as the third character of the word in the audio?
body.correct: Amazingly done! The third character in the word 床头柜 chuángtóuguì (nightstand) has the final “ui” and so does the third character in the word 有智慧 yǒuzhìhuì (intelligent/wise).
body.incorrect: Very close! Listen to the audio several times to identify the final for the third character, and then sound out the words in the choices to see which one has the same final.
